intro: Gymnostachyum trichosepalum, commonly known as the hairy-sepaled gymnostachyum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the sepals are covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
